attributes.action: Trial a four day working week
attributes.additional_details:
17.9m working days a year are lost to poor mental health, costing employers £45bn. Work-related illness cases are highest amongst healthcare workers costing employers like the NHS, up to £2,174 per person. 

78% report that moving to a four-day week has improved their happiness, with 64% of businesses reporting improved productivity.
Moving all public sector workers to 32-hour contracts, whilst maintaining current pay would only add 6% to the current salary budget, creating up to 500,000 jobs.
attributes.background: During the pandemic many businesses have adopted a 4-day week. Adopting a 4-day week would address the current mental health crisis by improving peoples work-life balance, whilst also increasing productivity and reducing business costs. This petition calls for a government trial of a four-day week.

rejection.details:
It's not clear what a Government trial of a four-day working week would involve, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Reduce the maximum working hours so people can do a four day week: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566626
